Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Ignore AndroidAsset items which are folders." (#1190) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
When adding a new subfolder in the IDE (VSForMac) we end up
with a folder which has a build action of AndroidAsset.
This causes the copy task to fail with

	Cannot copy <folder> to <destfolder>, as the source file doesn't exist",

This is because we assume that all items in AndroidAsset (and
AndroidResource) and files. It looks like this is not the case.
While a work around is easy .. simply remove the item. It does
require that the user manually update the csproj.

So this commit uses `Directory.Exists` to check to see if the
item is a directory or not. If it is we skip over it. Otherwise
its a file so we should copy.

We do this in `Files.cs` but also in `AndroidUpdateResDir.cs`.
The latter has been changed to output a list of the "Resolved"
files which will not include any folders.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Runtime unable to handle certain IL" (#1194) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

Consider the following struct:

```c#
unsafe partial struct C4BlobKey
{
    public fixed byte bytes[20];
}
```

and a corresponding C struct

```c
typedef struct C4BlobKey {
    uint8_t bytes[20];
} C4BlobKey;
```

I want to determine equality so I write the following `Equals()` function:

```c#
public override bool Equals(object obj)
{
    if(!(obj is C4BlobKey)) {
        return false;
    }

    var other = (C4BlobKey)obj;
    fixed(byte* b = bytes) {
        for(int i = 0; i < _Size; i++) {
            if(b[i] != other.bytes[i]) {
                return false;
            }
        }
    }

    return true;
 }
```

Debug and release mode both have the same following symptoms, but obviously with different lines since the release mode is optimized.

> Invalid IL code in LiteCore.Interop.C4BlobKey.Equals (object); IL_001c: stloc.2

In fact I have to instances of this type of class that do similar things and they both fail in the same way.  Here is the IL code (up to around the line in question):

    .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool 
    Equals(
      object obj
    ) cil managed 
    {
    .maxstack 3
    .locals init (
      [0] valuetype LiteCore.Interop.C4BlobKey other,
      [1] unsigned int8* b,
      [2] unsigned int8*& pinned V_2,
      [3] int32 i
    )

    // [51 13 - 51 36]
    IL_0000: ldarg.1      // obj
    IL_0001: isinst       LiteCore.Interop.C4BlobKey
    IL_0006: brtrue.s     IL_000a

    // [52 17 - 52 30]
    IL_0008: ldc.i4.0     
    IL_0009: ret          

    // [55 13 - 55 40]
    IL_000a: ldarg.1      // obj
    IL_000b: unbox.any    LiteCore.Interop.C4BlobKey
    IL_0010: stloc.0      // other
    IL_0011: ldarg.0      // this
    IL_0012: ldflda       valuetype LiteCore.Interop.C4BlobKey/'<bytes>e__FixedBuffer' LiteCore.Interop.C4BlobKey::bytes
    IL_0017: ldflda       unsigned int8 LiteCore.Interop.C4BlobKey/'<bytes>e__FixedBuffer'::FixedElementField
    IL_001c: stloc.2      // V_2

    // [56 19 - 56 34]
    IL_001d: ldloc.2      // V_2
    IL_001e: conv.u       
    IL_001f: stloc.1      // b

    // [57 21 - 57 30]
    IL_0020: ldc.i4.0     
    IL_0021: stloc.3      // i

    IL_0022: br.s         IL_0040
    // start of loop, entry point: IL_0040

This same IL works fine on UWP, and .NET Core. This problem also appears to exist in Xamarin iOS. 

### Expected Behavior

The IL gets handled as on other platforms

### Actual Behavior

The above exception

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Cannot automate Label clicking after XF 2.5.0 update" (#1589) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Unable to click on certain Labels via automation after updating a UWP app to latest Xamarin.Forms.

While Labels aren't usually directly "clickable", sometimes it's necessary to create compound controls which include Labels, such as in custom "buttons" or list items, when the stock XF Button or TextCell isn't sufficient. The Labels in question have parent view that is clickable either by nature (List item) or by TapGestureRecognizer, if it is a StackLayout.

Basic example 1: you want a button with configurable image positioning relative to the button text, or to be able to set text alignment of the button. Stock XF button cannot do this, so you throw an Image and Label inside of a StackLayout and put a TapGestureRecognizer on it. Whether the tap recognizer is on the parent or on the Label itself, neither are clickable in automation anymore.

Basic example 2: your listview item image sources are coming from outside the app and may have invonsistent sizes, and you want to fix the image size or use another library to cache the images. ImageCell cannot do this, so you use ViewCell with an Image and Label inside of a StackLayout.

This issue is not affecting Android; it only appears on UWP. Also, the issue appeared only after upgrading from Xamarin.Forms 2.3.2.127 => 2.5.0.122203. Reverting back to 2.3.2.127 confirmed this. Since working automation started failing after the XF update, this is assumed to be a Xamarin.Forms behavior change, not a bug in the Automation framework.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Find the element representing the Label (Selenium Ruby example below)
> `label = driver.find_elements(:name, "LabelName")`
2. The above returns an array with 1 element. Now, click on the element
> `label[0].click()`

### Expected Behavior
The clickable item containing the Label will respond to the click request on the label.

### Actual Behavior
> `label.click()`

```NoMethodError: undefined method `[]' for nil:NilClass
from C:/Ruby23/lib/ruby/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.5.2/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/response.rb:82:in `add_backtrace'```

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.122203
- Last known good version: 2.4.0.280
- IDE: Visual Studio 2015 Update 3
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Android: 7.1
  - UWP:  14393
- Affected Devices: Windows Desktop
- Automation used for UWP: Selenium via WinAppDriver (https://github.com/Microsoft/WinAppDriver)
- Automation used for Android: Calabash

### Reproduction Link
I have reproduced expected working functionality with XF 2.4.0.280 in a standalone app. After updating to 2.5.0 the error is reproduced. See Readme.md in the zip file for reproduction setup.

[LabelClickable.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1633244/LabelClickable.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "WebView fails to load from urlwebviewsource with non-ascii characters (works with Uri)" (#1583) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
When loading a WebView with the 'Source' set as a Uri the webview is quite tolerant.  If the 'Source' is setting using a UrlWebviewSource non-ascii characters cause the view to throw an exception


### Steps to Reproduce

1. create a page with a webview
2. set the Source equal to a url with a non-ascii character

example :
```
<WebView x:Name="WebView" HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand"
                     VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand">
 </WebView>
```

```
WebView.Source = new UrlWebViewSource { Url = "https://www.google.no/maps/place/Skøyen" };
```

### Expected Behavior
it should escape the url as needed and load without exception. When setting the source with a new Uri object it behaves as expected.

### Actual Behavior
Could not initialize an instance of the type 'Foundation.NSUrl': the native 'initWithString:' method returned nil.
It is possible to ignore this condition by setting MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.Class.ThrowOnInitFailure to false.

### Basic Information

Currently on Xamarin Forms
2.5.0.121934

### Description
When an SVG is used on a component, it displays fine but the output gets a warning "FileImageSourceHandler: Could not find image or image file was invalid:". This warning is obviously incorrect since it works.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Xamarin.Forms application;
2. Get an SVG;
3. Create a drawable vector from it;
4. Use the SVG on a component, such as a button or image;
5. Run the application.

No warning in the output.

### Actual Behavior
The following warning in the output - "FileImageSourceHandler: Could not find image or image file was invalid:".
